title: Recognizing the Service of U.S. Comptroller General Gene L. Dodaro

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to recognize the service of  and express my deep gratitude for my agriculture policy advisor, Aleksi  Knepp, for her outstanding service to my office over the past 2\1/2\  years.
title: Thanking Aleksi Knepp for Her Service to Illinois' 13th Congressional District

title: Communications Security Act

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to celebrate the Anaheim High  School girls' flag football championship win.
title: Recognizing Thanksgiving Food Drives

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to recognize Nayeli Andazola  for earning the Arvada Wheat Ridge Service Ambassadors for Youth Award.
title: Recognizing Nayeli Andazola

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to honor and celebrate the  legacy and remarkable life of a Louisville hometown hero, Dixie Demuth,  who fought for equality for women in Kentucky and left a permanent mark  on our city and commonwealth.
title: Recognizing the Extraordinary Life of Dixie Demuth

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to recognize Officer Robert  Scisco, a school resource officer at Rehoboth Elementary, who has been  named Delaware Mentor of the Month.
title: Thanking Officer Robert Scisco

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to oppose the administration's  cuts to critical gun violence prevention programs, and I rise today in  deep solidarity with the innovators of CeaseFire, violence  interrupters, and community organizations around this country that  spend every day, hour after hour, working on the ground and in our  communities to stop gun violence.
title: Supporting Gun Violence Prevention Programs

sentence: Speaker, I rise to today to ask for the House's support  for the Filipino Veterans Family Reunification Act, which I introduced  with my colleague Congresswoman Jen Kiggans of Virginia.
title: Introduction of the Filipino Veterans Family Reunification Act of 2025

sentence: Speaker, I rise today during National Police Week to  honor the courageous law enforcement officers from New Mexico who have  made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our communities.
title: National Police Week

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to recognize Amelia  Ferkuniak for earning the Arvada Wheat Ridge Service Ambassadors for  Youth Award.

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to express my gratitude  towards His All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew, the  Archbishop of Constantinople and spiritual leader of Orthodox  Christianity worldwide, for his time spent in our Nation's Capital last  week.
title: Appreciating the Presence and Contributions of His All-Holiness Ecumenical Patriarch Bartholomew

sentence: Speaker, I rise today on behalf of the rural  communities in Delaware and the hospitals that are their lifelines  because if the Republican budget is passed, that lifeline will be cut.
title: Keep Rural Hospitals Open As Lifeline

sentence: Speaker, I rise today to celebrate a stunning,  dominant victory by the UConn women's basketball team yesterday over a  very good University of South Carolina team by a margin of 23 points,  which actually is lower than really where it was for most of the second  half.
title: Congratulating Uconn Women's Basketball Stars
